Already answered in other course eval
Really good course. Important material to know

Loved it! Kept me engaged. Assignments made sense for the course. Flowed well. Very very useful skill developed. I also enjoyed how Professor Garstka taught  the class how to read, interpret and understand changes in financial statements.

The course was poorly structured and did not help me learn the material at all. The only way I learned was through homework assignments, which were also poorly structured because we had to do them in advance of the homework material actually being taught in class. So if there was no Investopedia and Google in general, not sure how I'd ever get through this class.

The course is organized very well in the sequence. The textbook is helpful, and the daily homework is essential to mastering the material. WIth that said, the lectures were not very helpful. PowerPoints didn't add any value to the course

Although the course is critical for my education here, I did not find it helpful especially in terms of evaluation. I do not think I was evaluated on what I learned in the course. the final exam was not reflective of the material that was covered.
pretty good, hard to understand complex concepts sometimes, but very good professor

Strengths: Good instructor and a great introduction to accounting.
Weaknesses: Unreasonable amount of homework.

Strengths: very interesting course
Weakness:  hard to learn

Strengths: this course really teaches you a whole new skillset through weekly practice. 
Weaknesses: there is not much breathing room in this course as you are always working on an assignment.
Improvements: have one assignment per week instead of per class
This class provides a great survey of accounting and some preliminary topics in finance. The high workload was very helpful in ensuring that I understood the material.

It is a comprehensive introduction to accounting and some basic finance concepts, that is great for someone who has never taken a similar course before or for someone who wants to refresh some concepts.

I've never taken an accounting class before and this is a great course to understand the fundamentals and it definitely piqued my interest about finance which I did not anticipate. The homework is challenging but absolutely instrumental to understanding the material.
Already answered in other course eval

Great instructor.
An expert in the file.

I absolutely adore Professor Garstka - he definitely made the course for me! He was extremely easy to learn from and very much enjoyed this course! I hope to take another course with Professor Garstka in the future!
Could not keep the students' attention at all. He's funny on occasion and clearly smart and knowledgeable about accounting, but definitely neither engaging nor interesting.
The professor is dedicated to this topic, however, I did find it hard to follow along to his lecturing style and slides. I did not find them to be organized.
I really like Professor Garstka's lectures and he is very helpful outside of class as well.
Prof. Garstka is an engaging professor. I really appreciated the enthusiasm with which he taught the course.
Great instructor
Professor Garstka is incredibly passionate about accounting and it shows in the classroom.
He is very engaged in the topics and and knowledgeable. Sometimes, however, Professor Garstka is going off topic a bit too much.

Professor Garstka is obviously brilliant but sometimes I find it hard to follow his teaching. I think I enjoyed his side comments about current events and the finance/accounting industry the best. I learned a lot though.
Already answered in other course eval
Good course, important material to know
Don't be timid! I was extremely nervous for this course, having never had an accounting course before. I ended up excelling in this course and really loving it!

I wanted to take accounting to understand the basic concepts and flows, and this class did accomplish that. However, it was mostly due to the work I put in myself, googling the homework material and trying to figure things out -- not because the class was taught in a way that is actually conducive to learning.
Expect to put a lot of work outside of the classroom to understand accounting.
Yes, since it is crucial to the curriculum but would like it to be more organized and would like the students to be evaluated on the material that was actually covered in class.
interesting if you want to know more about accounting. definitely not for everyone
This course is a lot of work, and the homework is unreasonable. However, it is a really good overview of accounting.
Difficult, lot of work, but very useful
Be prepared for very detail heavy meticulous work. Accounting is sort of like learning a new language if you have never been exposed to it before. Work in groups to learn and re-learn the material.
See question 6
Great course to understand the basics of accounting and finance. It's a fair bit of work but if you're willing to put it in, you will learn a lot.
